front_sentence: She sat quietly to contemplate the meaning of the poem.
front_quote: He contemplated whether her cooking could actually be classified as a war crime.""
back_sentence: Sie saß still da, um über die Bedeutung des Gedichts nachzudenken.

front_sentence: The discovery of penicillin was a classic case of serendipity.
front_quote: Finding a twenty-dollar bill in my old coat was a delightful moment of serendipity.""
back_sentence: Die Entdeckung des Penicillins war ein klassischer Glücksfall.

front_sentence: The beauty of the cherry blossoms is ephemeral, lasting only a few days.
back_word: so he knew that all glory is ephemeral.""
column6: Die Schönheit der Kirschblüten ist vergänglich und dauert nur wenige Tage.

front_sentence: Coffee shops have become ubiquitous in cities around the world.
column6: Cafés sind in Städten auf der ganzen Welt allgegenwärtig geworden.
